subject: Self Care
title: Workload Overload
description: A quick, practical guide to Workload Overload.

hook.text: She had three people's jobs after layoffs. Same pay. Same hours. Triple the work. Burnout was inevitable.

buildup.text: Unsustainable workload is the number one predictor of burnout. Too much work with too little time breaks anyone.

discovery.text: The issue isn't working hard. It's working hard without recovery. Sprints work. Marathons at sprint pace don't.

twist.text: High performers often volunteer for more, mistaking capacity for obligation. Saying yes to everything burns the candle faster.

climax.text: Audit your workload honestly. If it requires heroics daily, the workload is the problem â€” not your effort.

punchline.text: Heroic effort daily means broken systems, not weak people.

quiz.question: What is the number one predictor of burnout?
